marketNews.title: Government stimulus package of ~16.2 trillion rupiah announced
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said on Monday (15 September) that the government will provide an economic stimulus package of approximately IDR 16.2 trillion in Q4 2025. The package consists of eight programs: (1) graduate internship program; (2) expansion of employer-paid PPh 21 for tourism sector workers; (3) food assistance; (4) accident and death insurance premium assistance for non-wage workers such as online-motorcycle-taxi partners; (5) additional housing benefit services for BPJS Ketenagakerjaan; (6) cash-for-work scheme; (7) acceleration of deregulation of Government Regulation No. 28; (8) pilot urban projects in DKI Jakarta to improve housing quality and provide spaces for the gig economy.

marketNews.title: Continuation of four tax incentive programs in 2026
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, said the government will continue four tax incentive programs into 2026: (1) 0.5% final income tax (PPh) incentive for individual UMKM taxpayers, extended until 2029; (2) employer-paid PPh 21 for tourism sector workers with salaries up to IDR 10 million per month; (3) employer-paid PPh 21 for dense-labour sector workers with salaries up to IDR 10 million per month; (4) discount on accident and death insurance premiums for non-wage workers.

marketNews.title: Kopdes Merah Putih financing scheme with 200 trillion rupiah liquidity injection
marketNews.content: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa said the Village Cooperative (Kopdes) Merah Putih financing scheme will use a liquidity injection of IDR 200 trillion placed by the government in state-owned banks (Himbara). At the same time, Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs Zulkifli Hasan said the government is urging faster disbursement of loans for the Kopdes Merah Putih program and aims to fund 16,000 cooperatives by the end of the month. The government noted that Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) and Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS) have identified more than 1,000 eligible cooperatives that could borrow up to IDR 1.06 trillion. Purbaya explained that Himbara can reduce the interest rate it pays on government deposits to 2% if the funds are provided to Kopdes. Previously, Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) said the government cash placement would be invested in a six-month call-deposit instrument that can be rolled over, yielding an interest/return of about 4%.

marketNews.title: Indonesia cement industry sales volume down 3.8% YoY in August 2025
marketNews.content: Cement industry sales volume in Indonesia fell 3.8% year-on-year in August 2025, according to management of Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa (INTP). This resulted in an overall 3.3% YoY decline in cement sales volume for the first eight months of 2025 (8M25) compared with the same period in 2024 (which included Grobogan cement at +2.3% YoY). Management explained that the decline was caused by demonstrations at the end of August 2025 affecting the entire industry. By segment, bagged cement volume weakened by 0.3% YoY during 8M25 (vs. -1.7% YoY in 8M24), while bulk cement volume dropped 10% YoY (vs. +12% YoY in 8M24).

marketNews.title: Tax revenue net collection 990.01 trillion rupiah in 7M25, down 5.29% YoY
marketNews.content: The Directorate General of Taxes of the Ministry of Finance reported that net tax revenue (tax receipts after refunds) reached IDR 990.01 trillion during the first seven months of 2025, a decrease of 5.29% YoY, representing 47.7% of the 2025 APBN outlook target of IDR 2,077 trillion. Gross tax revenue (total tax receipts before refunds) amounted to IDR 1,269.4 trillion in the same period, up 2.3% YoY.

marketNews.title: India palm oil imports rise 15.8% MoM to 990.528 tons in August 2025
marketNews.content: The Solvent Extractors' Association of India reported that India's palm oil imports in August 2025 rose to 990.528 tonnes, an increase of 15.8% month-on-month, reaching the highest monthly level since July 2024. The rise was driven by more competitive palm oil prices compared with soybean oil, prompting purchases ahead of the festive season.

tickerNews.title: UNTR to acquire 100% of PT Arafura Surya Alam (ASA) from PSAB
tickerNews.content: United Tractors (UNTR) through its subsidiaries PT Danusa Tambang Nusantara and PT Energia Prima Nusantara announced that it has signed an agreement to acquire 100% of PT Arafura Surya Alam (ASA) – the operator and holder of the mining license for the Doup gold mine in North Sulawesi – from PT J Resources Nusantara (JRN), a subsidiary of J Resources Asia Pacific (PSAB). The agreed enterprise value of ASA is USD 540 million, approximately IDR 8.9 trillion based on an exchange rate of IDR 16,410 per USD. PSAB explained that the total enterprise value includes the purchase price for the shares, the value of minority shareholders’ shares in ASA and its subsidiary PT Mulia Bumi Persada, as well as the debt owed by JRN to ASA. PSAB also stated that the net proceeds from the share sale will be adjusted for certain balance-sheet items of ASA as of the transaction closing date. The transaction is expected to be completed no later than 23 December 2025, or on another date mutually agreed by the parties. UNTR’s Corporate Secretary Sara K. Loebis said the acquisition will be funded by the company’s internal cash. As of 31 December 2023, the Doup gold mine had total reserves of 1,571 thousand ounces (koz) of gold and total resources of 3,107 koz. The Doup project is not expected to commence operations until December 2024.

tickerNews.title: INTP reports 4.6% YoY decline in cement sales volume for 8M25
tickerNews.content: INTP: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded a decline in cement sales volume of 8.3% year-on-year in August 2025, with bulk cement volume down 13% YoY and bagged cement down 6% YoY. This resulted in an overall 4.6% YoY decline in cement sales volume for the first eight months of 2025 (8M25) compared with the same period in 2024 (which included Grobogan cement at +10% YoY). The company's market share fell to 29.3% (vs. 29.7% in 8M24 and 29.5% in 1H25). Management explained that sales in several locations were affected by demonstrations at the end of August 2025.

tickerNews.title: CDIA reports net profit of $67.8 million in 1H25
tickerNews.content: CDIA: Chandra Daya Investasi reported a net profit of USD 67.8 million in the first half of 2025, a 330% increase year-on-year, driven by a fair-value gain on investments of USD 46.6 million (there was no such gain in 1H24). Its other financial assets consist of a 4.99% stake in Raharja Energi Cepu (RATU), a 0.33% stake in Nippon Shokubai Co., Ltd., and a 0.45% stake in Keppel Infrastructure Trust. On the top line, revenue grew 42% YoY to USD 66.9 million, mainly due to the logistics segment which generated USD 15 million (vs. USD 0.1 million in 1H24).

tickerNews.title: TPIA secures $1 billion sustainability-linked syndicated loan
tickerNews.content: TPIA: Aster Chemicals and Energy, a joint venture between Chandra Asri Pacific and Glencore, announced that it has signed a sustainability-linked syndicated loan facility of USD 1 billion. The funds will be used for general corporate purposes, including asset renewal projects on Pulau Bukom and Jurong. DBS Bank Ltd. and OCBC acted as mandated lead arrangers, underwriters and bookrunners, as well as sustainability coordinators. The syndication also includes several domestic banks, such as Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) and Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI).

tickerNews.title: BUVA shares sold by Hapsoro, reducing stake to 5.56%
tickerNews.content: BUVA: Controlling shareholder Bukit Uluwatu Villa, Hapsoro, sold approximately 483.3 million BUVA shares at an average price of IDR 269 per share on 10-11 September 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 130 billion. After the sale, Hapsoro’s direct ownership in BUVA decreased from 7.91% to 5.56%. Previously, BUVA planned a rights issue of roughly 4 billion new shares at an exercise price of IDR 150 per share, with a ratio of 225:44 and an expected dilution of 16.36%. PT Nusantara Utama Investama stated it would become a standby buyer, with Hapsoro transferring its rights to the investor.

tickerNews.title: JSMR opens investment options in BUMN Karya toll roads
tickerNews.content: JSMR: Jasa Marga President Director Rivan A. Purwantono said the company is opening opportunities to invest in toll roads built by the state-owned construction firm BUMN Karya, although details were not disclosed. He explained that one strategy is to invest in toll road sections that connect with the company’s existing toll network. JSMR will continue to focus on toll roads on Java Island. For 2025, JSMR allocated capital expenditures of around IDR 10-12 trillion, with a 1H25 absorption of approximately IDR 5 trillion.

tickerNews.title: ELSA developing three pilot projects: CCUS, binary heat exchanger geothermal, battery charging stations
tickerNews.content: ELSA: Elnusa Director Arief Prasetyo Handoyo said the company is developing three pilot-stage businesses: carbon capture utilization and storage (CCUS), fabrication of binary heat exchanger geothermal and inflow control systems, and battery charging stations for the electric vehicle ecosystem.
